episode_title: 716 - The One With The Truth About London

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel is filing her nails as Ross and Ben enter.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Hi Ben!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi, we have a little bathroom emergency.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah go ahead.
(Ben starts to go, but Ross stops him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, before we do uh, are any of Joey’s special romance magazines in there?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay! All clear!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Thanks Phoebe!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ben, it’s Rachel! (He closes the door.) But whatever.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Everything okay in there?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Don’t talk to me now!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Awww, just like his daddy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey listen can you do me a big favor? The dean’s office just called and said there was an urgent meeting. Can you watch Ben for like an hour?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What-what about Monica?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, she isn’t home.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So it would just be me alone?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, Ben would be there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh umm…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well that—y’know it’s just uh, I’ve never done that before. Me and him alone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, he’s not an ex-con.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Okay. Okay. Uh, what do I, what do I do with him?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know! Just-just talk to him-entertain him and keep him alive.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. (Ben enters) Ben? Come here. All right, I’m gonna leave you here with Aunt Rachel for about an hour. Okay? Are you gonna be okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah I think so.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I wasn’t talking to you.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: I’ll be okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I’ll see you soon buddy. (He hugs and kisses him.) Be back in an hour.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Bye dad.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye. (Ross exits.) Ahhh… (Silence) So this is fun, huh?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Not really.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Uh, want something-want something to drink?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh great! How do you feel about Diet Coke ?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: I’m not allowed to have soda.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Well that’s pretty much all that we have—Oh! Oh! Have you ever had a virgin margarita? (Holds up a bottle of margarita mix.)

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: What’s a virgin?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Water it is.

content.description: Central Perk, Monica and Chandler are talking. Joey and Phoebe are getting coffee.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What about the second minister we met with? I kinda liked him.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You mean the spitter?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on! It wasn’t that bad!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Easy for you to say; you’ll be wearing a veil.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, what about the third guy?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You mean the guy who kept staring at your chest?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Can you blame him?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sorry, I just don’t like the idea of when I say “I do,” he’s thinking, “Yeah, I’d do her too!”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well then we still have a problem.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: With what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, we’re trying to find someone to perform our wedding and they’re all either boring or annoying or y’know, can’t stop staring at the ladies. (Points to her chest.)
(Joey nods his approval.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oo! You should have one of us do it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, we’re getting married , married; not sixth grade married.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! No! It’s-it’s uh a real thing! Anyone can get ordained on the Internet and perform like weddings and stuff!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you serious?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes! A friend of mine did it and it’s totally legal!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I call it!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?! No! It was my idea!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Guys thank you very much but neither of you is marrying us.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Does calling it not mean anything anymore?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We are going to have a legitimate member of the clergy! And when I say legitimate I mean, gay and in control of his saliva!

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel and Ben are sitting on the couch bored out of their minds.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ben y’know when uh, when you were a baby, you and I used to hang out all the time. ‘Cause I was, I was your daddy’s girlfriend.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: But you’re not anymore!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I’m not.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: ‘Cause you guys were on a break.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! We were not on a—Okay. That’s fine! Fine. Y’know what Ben? One day when you are a lot older I am going to tell you that entire story over a pitcher of real margaritas, okay?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: When’s my daddy coming back?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Fifty-two minutes. (Pause) So no-no brothers and sisters, huh? That must be nice. You don’t have to share stuff.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Sharing is good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, you’re one of those . But y’know what? I have two sisters of my own and we just-just tortured each other.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Really? Like how?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well y’know, we would umm, repeat everything the other said, or uh, we’d jump out of closets to scare each other, or switch the sugar for the salt so they’d put salt on their cereal.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: That’s a good one.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah? You like that one?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Yeah, you’re funny.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m funny? Oh thank God! Well hey, I’ve got a ton of these! Umm, oh here—Do you want a good one? Here’s a good one. Umm, you uh, you take a quarter, take a quarter and, and you blacken the edge. Right? (Does so.) And then you say to person, I bet you can’t roll this quarter from your forehead to your chin without it leaving your face. And then when they do it, they’re left with a big black pencil line right down the center of their face.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Can I do it to you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I-I-I-I’m funny Ben, but I’m not stupid. Okay?

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica and Chandler are eating lunch as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, did you uh, find anyone to marry you guys yet?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, but Horny for Monica Minister called, wanting to know if we were still together.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re never gonna find anybody.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well then let me do it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joe…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no! Look, I’ve been thinking about it. I’m an actor right? So I won’t get nervous talking in front of people.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey look it’s really sweet…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no-no look no! I won’t spit, and I won’t stare at Monica’s breasts! Y’know? Everyone knows I’m an ass man!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That is true.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah and the most important thing is that it won’t be some like, stranger up there who barely knows you. It’ll be me! And I swear I’ll do a really good job. Plus, y’know I love you guys and-and it would really mean a lot to me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, we haven’t found anybody else.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It might be kinda cool.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So I can do it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah you can do it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right!!! Okay!! All right! Okay-okay, I gotta get started on my speech! Oh, wait a minute, Internet ministers can still have sex right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.
(Phoebe enters slowly.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Pheebs, how’s it going?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I have a headache. A horrible headache!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. Can I get you something?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, you’ve got to stop chattering!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here, take a couple of these. (She gets up to grab a couple of pills.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What is it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s Hexadrin.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, I don’t believe in Western medicine. No, if you just apply pressure to these points right here. (She’s pinching the bit of skin between her right thumb and forefinger with her left hand.) Then your hand starts to hurt and you still have a headache, so thanks. (Takes the pills.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, while we’re waiting for these pills to kick in, I’m gonna sit you down on the couch. Come on. (Phoebe gets up and goes with her.) Get some nice soft pillows under your head, I’m gonna turn the TV on and you can watch whatever you want. And I’m—Sit down—(She sits down on the couch)—gonna make you some tea. And then, I’m gonna rub your feet.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh! My head! Oh! (He’s sitting on the chair, lies back, and puts his feet up for Monica to rub.) Oh!

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel is reading and there is knock on the door which she answers.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Coming.
(She opens the door to reveal Ross with a pencil mark from his forehead to his chin.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I have a bone to pick with you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-oh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes! Ben learned a little trick.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah? Did he pull the old… (She is waving her hand up and down her face. She’s thinking about the pencil mark.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right! That’s right! Saran Wrap on the toilet seat so the pee goes everywhere!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah that! You know I hate practical jokes! They’re mean and they’re stupid and-and I don’t want my son learning them!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, come on! Saran Wrap on the toilet seat, you don’t think that’s just a little funny?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was barefoot. Now tell me, the toilet thing is the only thing you taught him right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe, Chandler, and Monica are there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s amazing! My headache is completely gone! What are those pills called?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hexadrin. (She gets the box out of her purse.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I love you Hexadrin! (She kisses the box.) Oh look! It comes with a story! (She pulls out the instructions and side effects paper.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No Phoebe, those are like the side effects and stuff.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Say what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, the possible side effects.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! (Starts reading them.) Dizziness, nervousness, drowsiness, facial swelling, nausea, headache—Headache. Vomiting, stomach bleeding, liver damage! Now okay, I don’t recall any of this coming up when you gave me these little death capsules! Oh I’m sorry, extra strength death capsules!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, relax none of that stuff ever happens! They just put it on there for legal reasons!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: In case it happens.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Say hello to Reverend Joey Tribbiani! (Holds up the piece of paper bearing the proof of his ordination.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You did it! You got ordained?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I just got off the Internet! Man, there is a lot of porn out there!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Our minister…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I have liver damage. Ow! Oh! (She grabs the left side of her torso.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, your liver is right here. (She points to the right side of her torso.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, then I must be disoriented.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Anyway, I started working on what I’m going to say for the ceremony, do you wanna hear it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now-now, listen this is just a first draft so… (Starts to read the piece of paper he brought.) “We are gathered here today on this joyous occasion to celebrate the special love that Monica and Chandler share.” (Monica and Chandler like it so far.) Eh? (He continues reading.) “It is a love based on giving and receiving. As well as having and sharing. And the love that they give and have is shared and received. And through this having and giving and sharing and receiving.” (Phoebe nods her approval.) “We too can share and love and have and receive.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Should we call the spitter?

content.description: Carol and Susan’s, there is a knock on the door and Carol opens it to reveal Rachel.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Hey Rachel! (The camera cuts to her face and we see that Ben pulled the quarter trick with her as well.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: What a nice surprise! What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well y’know I was just in the neighborhood and I passed by your building and I thought to myself, “What’s up with Carol and sweet, little Ben?”

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Can I ask what—Come on in.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Umm uh, I’ll make some coffee and we can uh, chat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’d love that. I would loooove… (Carol goes to make the coffee and she sits down.) So uh, so where is sweet little Ben? I would love to have a little…

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Gotcha!! (Rachel jumps up startled.)
content.parenthetical: jumping up from behind her chair

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I found him! (To Ben) Very funny, come here! (She sits down on the coffee table and Ben walks up.) That is exactly why I’ve come here to talk to you okay?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Rach, do you want some sugar in your coffee?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes oh—(To Ben)—Do I want sugar in my coffee? (Ben nods no.) No, just some milk would be good Carol. Thanks. (To Ben) Okay, do you remember all that stuff I taught you yesterday?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Remember all that stuff I taught you yesterday?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Don’t do that.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Don’t do that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Seriously, your dad doesn’t like pranks.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Seriously, your dad doesn’t like pranks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh damnit!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Oh damnit!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Don’t say that! Don’t say that!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Damnit!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No don’t! Go back to repeating!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Damnit!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh crap!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Oh crap!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Phoebe, Joey, Chandler, and Monica are returning from Central Perk.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I feel like my face is swelling. (To Monica) Is my face swelling?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, your face is fine! Come on, none of this stuff is going to happen to you! Stop being such a baby!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, interesting you should call me that! Now that I may never have one! (Holds up the warning label.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay you guys, I got a little more written. Are you ready?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. O-okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: “When I think of the love that these two givers and receivers share, I can not help but envy the lifetime ahead of having and loving and giving and…” And then I can’t think of a good word for right here. (He points to the stop on the paper where he left off.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How about receiving?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See Joe, not that that’s not grrreat! But, one of the cool things about having somebody we know perform the ceremony is that it can be about us! Y’know, it can be more personal. You can tell stories about us!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, like the time you and I went to Atlantic City and I made you laugh so hard you threw up your whole steak?! Remember?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, not us… (Motions Joey and him.) Us! (Motions Monica and him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I gotcha. Sorry. (To Monica) So, did you ever make him throw up a whole anything?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Did you ever feed him a poison capsule that made him bleed from the eyes?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It doesn’t say that!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Suddenly somebody knows all about the side effects!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See Joe, we want you to tell stories but y’know, romantic stories. Nice stories.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. Okay. Ooh! Ooh! Okay, maybe I’ll talk about London! Y’know when you two hooked up! Only, only I won’t say hooked up. I’ll say, “Began their beautiful journey…”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: There you go!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: “…by doin’ it.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joe?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. All right. Umm, so uh, so how did it happen? Did your eyes meet across the room? And then the next thing y’know you’re in the bathtub together and she’s feeding you strawberries?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Isn’t that what happened with you and the bridesmaid?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!! I call that London style.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No that is not what happened with us. Well, I was umm, I was really sad that night because this guy thought that I was Ross’s mom.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And then Chandler was, was really sweet and he consoled me. And well we drank too much…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah baby!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And I was a perfect gentleman and I walked her to her hotel room and said goodnight.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But then later that night…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah baby!
[Cut to London, Chandler’s hotel room. He is getting ready for bed by doing push-ups. One push-up. Just as he gets under the covers, there’s a knock on the door.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Cute PJ’s! You’re really livin’ it up here in London huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well I was… I wasn’t exactly expecting company after…(He looks at his watch.) 9:15.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is Joey here?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, last time I saw him he was heading out the door with the bridesmaid and a bucket of strawberries. So uh, you’re not still upset about what that guy told ya are ya?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wouldn’t you be?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, look it’s been a really emotional time y’know, and you’ve had a lot to drink. And you’ve just got to let that go okay? I mean you were the most beautiful woman in the room tonight!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You kidding? You’re the most beautiful woman in most rooms… (She jumps up and kisses him.) (Breaking the kiss.) Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! What’s going on? You and I just made out! You and I are making out?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, not anymore.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But we don’t do that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know, I just thought it would be fun.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How drunk are you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Drunk enough to know that I want to do this. Not so drunk that you should feel guilty about taking advantage.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s the perfect amount!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay!
(They run to the bed, sit down, and start making out again.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what’s weird?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This doesn’t feel weird!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re a really good kisser.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I have kissed over four women. (They kiss again.) Do you wanna get under the covers?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hm-hmm!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay!
(They do so and they take off their clothes.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! You are really fast!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It bodes well for me that speed impresses you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re gonna see each other naked.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yep!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you wanna do it at the same time?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Count of three?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: One!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Two!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Two!

content.speaker: Monica and Chandler
content.text: Three! (They lift up the covers and check each other out, then come back up with silly grins on their faces.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well I think it’s safe to say that our friendship is effectively ruined.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Eh, we weren’t that close anyway!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Eh!
(They start making out again, and it takes Joey trying to enter to stop them.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey! Joey! Joey! J-J-Joey-Joey-J-Joey! (Monica hides under the covers as Joey enters. Remember?)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Joe! I was just watching a movie-e-e… (Notices that the TV is turned off.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, dude I’m so sorry!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! No! No!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey no-no-no-no! It’s cool! It’s cool! I-I’ll only be a second, I’m still with my bridesmaid, I just—Where are those condoms you brought?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They’re in my bag over there. (Points.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah. (Joey walks to Chandler’s bag by getting as far away from Chandler’s bed as possible.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, could you leave me one?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: For just you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey listen, why don’t you come downstairs with me? There’s some really nice girls down there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No I-I-I’m fine.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, here you go buddy. (He tosses him one.) Go nuts. (Exits.)
[Cut back to Monica and Chandler telling Phoebe and Joey the story.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s what that was?! ‘Cause that other thing? I thought you were on to something, but it did nothing for me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, can we change the topic? Because it’s really doing nothing for me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh… (To Chandler) Can you imagine if I hadn’t left you that last one? You two might’ve never gotten together. Ooh-ooh! Could you imagine if I sent that hooker up to the room like I was gonna?! It’s like it was in the stars!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, it’s totally meant to be. (To Monica) Tell him who you originally wanted to hook up with that night.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who did you originally want to hook up with?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, fine but please don’t be upset! Okay? I was really depressed okay? And really drunk! I just wanted something stupid and meaningless. I just wanted…just sex. So, when I…went to your room that night…I was actually looking…for Joey. (Joey smiles.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah baby! (Chandler glares at him.) No baby!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, scene continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you came to the room looking for Joey? Did you ever in-intend on telling me about this?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, because it-it didn’t seem important.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, it’s not important? It’s not important?! If it wasn’t for a bridesmaid you’d be marrying him (Points to Joey) not me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Noo!! The point is that is was you that was there that night! It is you that I am marrying! It is you that I fell in love with!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And it is a love that is based on having and giving and receiv—(Shuts up on Monica’s glare.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t believe it. The most romantic night of my life and I’m runner up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, please! Do you know how unbelievably glad I am that Joey was not there that night?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! (Monica turns and looks at him) Now I’m a man of the cloth, but I still have feelings!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look there is no way you’re doing this wedding now. Okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?! That’s not fair! It’s not my fault! I was off with my bridesmaid! And who’s to say I would’ve even said yes?! (To Monica) I mean I would’ve said yes. Chandler look y-y-you are making way too big a deal out of this, all right? Look, everything worked out okay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, it’s just weird! Okay? I don’t want to be standing their saying my vows and then having the mental image of you and Monica! I-I-I need…I don’t know what I need. I need a walk.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait Chandler come on, let’s—it’s not a big deal!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It is to me. You wanted to sleep with Batman , and instead you had to settle for Robin . (Walks out and slams the door.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is crazy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know! Robin is so gay!

content.description: Carol and Susan’s, Rachel is talking with Ben.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So now what have we agreed?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: No more pranks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And-and what else?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: That you and daddy were not on a break.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Very good.
(There’s a knock on the door and Ross enters.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rachel! What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m just visiting my good friend Carol.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Your good friend?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s her last name?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Carol…Lesbian?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nice. And by the way that uh, that line down my face?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What line?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wh-wh-what line? The line that prompted a student in my last class of the day to say uh, (In a college frat boy voice) “Dude, don’t you ever wash your face?”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, I’m sorry. I’m sorry I didn’t tell you but you were so mad already!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Of course I was mad! I told you I-I hate this stuff! Okay? It-it’s not funny!

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Hey Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: What’s not funny?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Practical jokes.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Oh I…I think they’re funny.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You have a line down your face.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: What? (Goes and checks.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, maybe they are not funny to you…

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Or Carol! But they’re funny to kids and who is it hurting?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, y’know what? I’ll tell you who it hurts! It hurts the kid who has all his clothes stolen in gym class so he has to go to the principal’s office wearing nothing but a catcher’s mitt!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That was you ?! We heard about you in Junior High! Did you really just shake your fist in the air and shout, “I will be revenged?!”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I will be! Listen, I don’t want you teaching my son that stuff anymore. Okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Fine. Fine, but I’ll have you know that once I taught him that stuff he called me Fun Aunt Rachel. And I loved being Fun Aunt Rachel but I’ll go back to being Boring and Uncomfortable Aunt Rachel if that’s what you want!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No that’s not what I want. Uh, I’m glad you guys were bonding but I…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look he doesn’t have any brothers or sisters, somebody’s gonna have to teach him this stuff! And I haven’t taught him anything that a normal 6-year-old doesn’t know anyway!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Crap!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I gotta go! (Runs out.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler is sulking on the couch as Joey enters to talk with him.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey. Do you want this scone? (Holds up his plate) It came for me but it would probably rather sleep with you!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler, come on nothing even happened!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look Joe, I know you wanted to do the wedding…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-hey-no! If you don’t want me to do it, I accept that. I don’t care about that. I just…I don’t want you to be upset.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How can I not be upset? Okay? I finally fall in love with this fantastic woman and it turns out that she wanted you first!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah for like a half an hour one night! Chandler, she wants you for the rest of her life! You’re so lucky! Look what I missed out on by not being there! Although you know what? It could never have worked like you guys did, ‘cause you guys are perfect for each other. Y’know, we look at you and-and we see you together and it just…it-it fits. Y’know? And you just know it’s gonna last forever.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s what you should say.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: When you’re marrying us; that’s what you should say.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really? I can do it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’d love it if you would do it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! (They hug.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But those are the words! Those exact words!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well I don’t know if I remember exactly but, it’s-it’s pretty much about having and giving and sharing and receiving.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel is in the kitchen as Ross and Ben are entering.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey I’m sorry to do this to you again but uh, is there any way you can look after Ben for a little bit? I-I’ve got this meeting at school. And-and he-he asked for his uh, ‘Fun Aunt’ Rachel, so…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhh! Well of course I will watch him! We have fun, don’t we Ben? (He nods yes.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I’ll see you later pal.
(Ross turns to leave.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, okay. (Ross has a sign on his back that reads ‘Poop.’) Wh—Ah-ha! (Ross stops and turns.) Wait a minute. Uh Ben, I can’t do it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can’t let him go out that way, he’s got a meeting. (To Ross) You’ve got something here on your back.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? (She takes the sign off and hands it to him.) That’s great. That is great. (Crumples up the paper and throws it down in anger.) What did we just finish talking about Ben?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh I…

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: What did we just finish talking about Ben?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, that’s it! (He runs over to Ben, who runs past him and out the door.) Come—you—no! You are in big trouble young man!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Wait! Come on!
[Cut to the hallway, Ben runs upstairs with Ross in pursuit.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait! No! Ben, come here! I am not kidding!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No you guys… (She walks out into the hallway.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I-I-am—(Suddenly Ross starts screaming and comes falling down the stairs landing just in front of Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: EHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!! My God!!!!!!!!!!! Oh my God!!!!!!! (She runs over to him and finds that it was a dummy and that she had been had.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are entering. Phoebe and Joey are sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey-hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So are guys doing okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, we talked and Monica made me see that I over reacted a little bit and some things in life are more important.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah baby! (Phoebe and Joey nod.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m really glad you guys are okay but, I just keep thinking what would happen if-if you two (Points to Monica and Joey) actually had hooked up.

content.description: Monica and Joey’s, Monica is cooking.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey! Dinner’s ready!
(Joey, whose new diet is working out great, he looks like he only weighs 375 down from 420 enters from the bedroom.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s my little chef got for me tonight?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Your favorite!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ho-ho-ho, (pausing for a rest next to the fridge) fried stuff with cheese!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yep! And lot’s of it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks sweetheart. Give me a little sugar here. (They kiss.) Okay.
(Joey sits down.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, in we go.
(Monica gets behind him and in combination with his sliding the chair forward and her pushing with her leg manages to get up to the table.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Here we go! Here we go! Here we go! (Groans and picks up a piece of food.) How you doin’?

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is getting Phoebe some coffee.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Here you go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! This is a six-hour pill! (Checks her watch) That’s it! I’m out of the woods! Ohh! What a relief!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good for you!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, it’s like a huge weight has been lifted! ‘Cause look, (reads the side effects) no hair loss, not a rash, no hives, I’m just so happy! Because no shortness of breath, no temporary euphoria—Oh.
